parent1.algorithm: The new algorithm involves identifying edges that are heavily used in the local optimal tour and updating their distance in the edge distance matrix to prioritize less frequently used edges, thus promoting exploration of different routes.
parent1.code:
import numpy as np

def update_edge_distance(edge_distance, local_opt_tour, edge_n_used):
    updated_edge_distance = np.copy(edge_distance)
    max_used_edge = np.argmax(edge_n_used)
    for i in range(len(local_opt_tour)-1):
        start = local_opt_tour[i]
        end = local_opt_tour[i+1]
        updated_edge_distance[start][end] *= (1 + edge_n_used[start][end]/max_used_edge)
    return updated_edge_distance

parent2.algorithm: The new algorithm will update the edge distance matrix by decreasing the distances of the heavily used edges in the local optimal tour to promote exploration of less frequently used edges, while increasing the distances of non-participating edges to allow for better exploration of the entire graph.
parent2.code:
import numpy as np

def update_edge_distance(edge_distance, local_opt_tour, edge_n_used):
    updated_edge_distance = np.copy(edge_distance)
    for i in range(len(local_opt_tour)-1):
        start_node = local_opt_tour[i]
        end_node = local_opt_tour[i+1]
        if edge_n_used[start_node, end_node] > np.mean(edge_n_used):  # Decrease distance of heavily used edges
            updated_edge_distance[start_node, end_node] *= 0.9
            updated_edge_distance[end_node, start_node] *= 0.9
        else:
            updated_edge_distance[start_node, end_node] *= 1.1  # Increase distance of non-participating edges
            updated_edge_distance[end_node, start_node] *= 1.1
    return updated_edge_distance

parent3.algorithm: New algorithm: The strategy is to identify the edges in the local optimal tour that are frequently used and update their distances in the edge distance matrix to discourage using them again, thereby guiding the search towards a better solution.

parent4.algorithm:
New algorithm: Modify the edge distances randomly along the local optimal route to escape from the local optimum and move towards a global optimum, by perturbing the distances of the edges used in the local optimal tour.

Code:
import numpy as np

def update_edge_distance(edge_distance, local_opt_tour, edge_n_used):
    updated_edge_distance = np.copy(edge_distance)
    
    for i in range(len(local_opt_tour) - 1):
        start_node = local_opt_tour[i]
        end_node = local_opt_tour[i + 1]
        edge_index = edge_n_used[start_node][end_node]
        perturbation_factor = np.random.uniform(0.9, 1.1)  # Randomly perturb the edge distance
        updated_edge_distance[start_node][end_node] *= perturbation_factor
    
    return updated_edge_distance

import numpy as np

def update_edge_distance(edge_distance, local_opt_tour, edge_n_used):
    updated_edge_distance = np.copy(edge_distance)
    
    for i in range(len(local_opt_tour) - 1):
        start_node = local_opt_tour[i]
        end_node = local_opt_tour[i + 1]
        edge_index = edge_n_used[start_node][end_node]
        perturbation_factor = np.random.uniform(0.9, 1.1)  # Randomly perturb the edge distance
        updated_edge_distance[start_node][end_node] *= perturbation_factor
    
    return updated_edge_distance

parent5.algorithm: New algorithm: The strategy is to identify the edges in the local optimal tour that are frequently used and update their distances in the edge distance matrix to discourage using them again, thereby guiding the search towards a better solution.

offspring.algorithm: New algorithm: Identify the least frequently used edges in the local optimal tour and update their distances in the edge distance matrix to encourage exploration of different routes, while also randomizing the distances of non-participating edges to promote diversification in the search for a better solution.
offspring.code:
import numpy as np

def update_edge_distance(edge_distance, local_opt_tour, edge_n_used):
    updated_edge_distance = np.copy(edge_distance)
    min_used_edge = np.argmin(edge_n_used)
    for i in range(len(local_opt_tour)-1):
        start = local_opt_tour[i]
        end = local_opt_tour[i+1]
        if edge_n_used[start][end] < np.mean(edge_n_used):  # Update distances of least frequently used edges
            updated_edge_distance[start][end] *= (1 - edge_n_used[start][end]/min_used_edge)
            updated_edge_distance[end][start] *= (1 - edge_n_used[end][start]/min_used_edge)
        else:  # Randomly perturb the distances of non-participating edges
            perturbation_factor = np.random.uniform(0.9, 1.1)
            updated_edge_distance[start][end] *= perturbation_factor
            updated_edge_distance[end][start] *= perturbation_factor
    return updated_edge_distance
